intro: Pycnocomon rutifolium, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically heart-shaped and have a bright yellow coloration. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Pycnocomon rutifolium is also noted for its ability to tolerate partial shade and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
